title: 104_hr1663
content: The Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act, also known as the "Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Act" (Public Law 102-579), repeals certain sections and definitions, amends management plans, and addresses test phase activities. Section 6 of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act is amended by repealing subsections and paragraphs, redesignating subsections, and making changes to the study requirements. In Section 6, subsection (d) is amended to simplify testing requirements and redesignated as subsection (b). SEC. 6. DISPOSAL OPERATIONS. Amends Section 7(b) to specify requirements for commencing disposal operations at WIPP, including certification of compliance with disposal regulations and acquisition of Federal Oil and Gas Leases. SEC. 7. EPA DISPOSAL REGULATIONS. Section 8(d)(1) of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act is amended to include a schedule for the incremental submission of application chapters to the Administrator within 30 days of enactment. The Administrator will review chapters and request additional information for completeness within 45 days of receipt. Congress will be notified of these requests. Section 8 of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act is amended to include a schedule for submitting all chapters to the Administrator by October 31, 1996. The Secretary shall use engineered and natural barriers at WIPP to comply with disposal regulations. Section 8 of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act is amended to include a schedule for submitting all chapters to the Administrator by October 31, 1996. The Secretary shall use engineered and natural barriers at WIPP to comply with disposal regulations. Compliance with environmental laws and regulations is required. Section 9 of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act is amended to exempt transuranic mixed waste designated for disposal at WIPP from certain land disposal restrictions. Subsections (b) and (c) of section 9 are repealed, and section 14 is amended to include exceptions from the land disposal regulations. The Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act exempts transuranic mixed waste designated for disposal at WIPP from specific land disposal restrictions. SEC. 9. RETRIEVABILITY. Amends Section 10 regarding the disposal of transuranic waste and sets a deadline for a decision. Decommissioning of WIPP is also addressed in Section 10. Economic assistance and miscellaneous payments are covered in Section 11. SEC. 11. ECONOMIC ASSISTANCE AND MISCELLANEOUS PAYMENTS. Amends Section 15(a) to provide $20,000,000 annually to the State for 15 years starting from the enactment of the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant Land Withdrawal Amendment Act. This appropriation is separate from any funding for WIPP. SEC. 12. NON-DEFENSE WASTE. Amends Section 7(a) to allow WIPP to receive non-defense transuranic waste within specified limits and capacity.
